case_title: Messrs Ghalib City vs Additional Commissioner Pra, Jarranwala and another

accussed_details.name: Messrs Ghalib City
allegation: Failure to voluntarily register under Section 25 of Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012
Non-payment of sales tax amounting to Rs. 18,522,075/-
Violation of Sections 3, 10, 18, and 35 of Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012

complaint_summary: The appellant failed to voluntarily register under Section 25 of the Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012 and was compulsorily registered. Sales tax on services amounting to Rs. 18,522,075/- was assessed against the appellant for taxable services provided as a property developer.
investigation_summary: The appellant was compulsorily registered on 03.04.2017 under Section 27 of the Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012. Notices were issued for tax payment, but the appellant failed to respond or contest the assessment. The Additional Commissioner assessed the tax liability based on approved development area and applicable tax rates.
judgment_summary: The appeal was dismissed. The court upheld the findings of the Commissioner (Appeals) and Additional Commissioner, stating the appellant was given sufficient time and opportunities to contest the tax liability but failed to do so. The court found no illegality in the impugned order.
punishment: Liability to pay Rs. 18,522,075/- in sales tax along with default surcharge under Section 49 of the Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012.

contentions: Show-cause notice was vague and lacked specification of allegations.
Nature of services allegedly provided was not determined.
Compulsory registration does not justify tax liability.
Appeal not maintainable as Punjab Revenue Authority was not arrayed as a party.
Appellant was given sufficient time and opportunities to defend.
Tax liability was established based on government-provided information.

statutes: Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012
key_issues: Failure to voluntarily register under Section 25 of Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012
Liability for sales tax on services provided by property developers
Sufficiency of time and opportunities given to appellant for defense
key_findings: Taxable services were identified based on approved area of development land.
Appellant was compulsorily registered after multiple notices and intimation.
Sufficient time and opportunities were provided to the appellant for defense.
Explanation clause of Section 25 denies exemption from tax liability due to lack of registration.

reasoning: Show-cause notice contained clear charges and applicable provisions.
Appellant failed to provide defense despite multiple opportunities.
Tax liability is enforceable under the law regardless of registration status.
decision.order: Appeal dismissed and impugned order upheld.

maxims.Natural Justice: Appellant argued deprivation of right to hearing based on principle of natural justice.

legal_terms.Compulsory Registration: Mandatory registration imposed by the Authority under Section 27 of Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012.
legal_terms.Default Surcharge: Additional charge imposed for delayed payment under Section 49 of the Act.

words_and_phrases.Taxable Services: Services provided by property developers, builders, and promoters as per Entry No. 15 of Second Schedule of Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012.

legal_basis.act: Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012
legal_basis.rules_cited: Punjab Sales Tax on Services (Adjudication and Appeals) Rules, 2012

summary_vector_notes: The appellant, Messrs Ghalib City, was compulsorily registered under the Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012 for taxable services as a property developer. Despite multiple notices, the appellant failed to contest the assessed tax liability of Rs. 18,522,075/-. The court dismissed the appeal, upholding the findings of the Commissioner (Appeals) and Additional Commissioner, citing sufficient opportunities given to the appellant to defend its case.
